alert.note: Alert for Fisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 7:10PM CDT until July 10 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Fisher. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 709 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rotan. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... SH 70 crossing The Draw Southeast of Rotan, FM 611 crossing 1 mile west of Rotan and FM 611 crossing 7 miles west of Rotan.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
